comments.commentBody: Is there a difference between initial conditions and boundary values?

It's not the "Trump" or "white people" factor in Florida; it's the Hillary factor and ain't nothing that can be done about that--dates back to Little Rock.

Like a hurricane named Hillary, just seems to gather more destructive energy everyday in the Sunshine state.

Whenever I hear Trump, his handlers, Hannity or Dobbs speak, I can't help but to think back to the mid sixties when George Wallace and Lester Maddox dominated the political scene with their racist and bigoted remarks. I had hoped that the ensuing fifty years would finally put this attitude to rest. I now really believe that the current crop aforementioned are nothing more than disciples of Wallace and Maddox. We as a society have not advanced after all, as many of us had hoped. The hope and change to which Mr. Obama aspired has become despair and hopelessness.

Even before last week's disasters, it was looking possible for Clinton to lose an election that ought to have been unlosable. If the endless emphasis on identity politics on the Democrat side makes it possible for Trump to peel off another good slice of the white working class, tired of the all moralistic lecturing, she could lose this. If Clinton runs purely on questions of competence, keeping that issue in the minds of voters of all kinds at all times, it should be no contest. It's not too late to change course.
Black voters keep Hillary's hopes alive (oops)
Reality check with 40 percent of what lest then .5 percent national vote

I have followed Mr. Cohn since he came to The Times from The Atlantic and I have found him a man who lives and dies by his numbers, incapable of seeing beyond that. His total dismissal of the Sanders campaign from the beginning was a sight to behold, even with his hundreds of thousands of supporters showing up at rallies. What betrayed him ultimately was his dismissal of Trump from the beginning, ignoring the numbers and revealing his prejudice. At the end of the campaign he wrote and apology column about, not Sanders, but about Trump. Take my advice and take his numbers with more than a grain of salt. A man incapable of seeing past them can never be trusted, not really. I wonder if he had been around for Obama, what he would have been writing then. I wonder.

Seriously couldn't Republican/Independent leaning voters just resolve that they will vote for Clinton then initiate steps to impeach after she is elected?

I know this sounds cockamanie but electing someone who appears to be V. Putin's "useful idiot," an extremely well deserved description, is going to be a nightmare for the country.

The initial fear that Trump was a wrecking ball who has brought the Republican Party to the brink of falling apart now appears to be close to using that wrecking ball on the country itself.

It sounds like it would be a matter of time before Trump tries to start a war or send in hordes of drones for god knows what kind of pique in who knows what insignificant country that Trump perceives to slight him.

Trump isn't capable of separating the country's interests from his own.

After 4 bankruptcies no one would lend him money. It really seems like Russian oligarchs were the only ones with deep pockets and the interest in "owning" Trump. His mysterious Russian connections outdo anything shady Clinton has done by a mile.

Be very afraid.

If Christi gives his EZ Pass to Trump , Florida might be a Bridge too far for the Man , Given that Trump was given almost 800 million in tax subsidies in NYC for his Enterprises, could it be that Florida has been "shelling out" a commensurate amount for his good works down here. Guess whose paying the taxes without receiving the benefits folks......

This election turns on one and only one question:

Can America's white supremacists wrench authoritarian power from our traditional pluralistic constitutional democracy?

In an unfortunate but, ironic juxtaposition of both rationale and spirit, the headline could just as easily read;
"Trump Keeps White Voter's Hopes Alive"

It is impossible for Trump to be elected.

Republicans may live in an all “White Bubble” but elections take place in the real world. The media is trying so hard to turn this into a Pay-For-View Wresting match.

The only reason this race seems close is because everything Trump says is given front page News. Trump’s is a Media Creation not a candidate.

Florida still has a significant White racist population but this in no way compares to the Latino and people of Color demographics in the State. Trump cannot win the election.

Trump’s angry White Male Presidential campaign sells news but it cannot get you elected in 2016.

The USA is now a mix of African Americans, Jews, Muslims, Gays, Mexicans.. etc. The Republicans are usually the last to get the memo.

The polls seem to show the race narrowing especially for the key states.

However, they do not reflect the enormous impact on the ground of Gov. Gary Johnson including in Florida and other must take states.

The Libertarians currently have over 50,000 volunteers of which i am one.

We are working overtime up until Nov. 8 to make sure that ClinTrump are denied 270.

Seven states have been targeted with several others in the second tier.

We are in double digits in over 40 states and within 4 points of second place in four states.

We expect to take a few states.

Our get out the vote strategy is in place and we shall be making sure that our chief supporters, millennials and enlisted personnel, get to vote.

The level of disgust with ClinTrump makes things fairly easy in getting people aboard.

2016 will be the end of the RepDem duopoly which more and more Americans hate.

Now we can kill it once and for all.

The only wasted vote is voting for someone you don't believe in.

johnsonweld.com
Cue unsubstantiated accusations of white racism...
What's missing here is the actual number of people polled. Critical information is missing.
When blacks overwhelmingly support a candidate, it's noble. When whites overwhelmingly support a candidate, it's racism.

The seas are rising. Your water is getting salty. Sinkholes on the increase. Do you want to contribute to the problem, or do you want to vote for people who will work to solve it? Don't vote for climate science fakers. You wouldn't go to a doctor who was less qualified and went against 97% of his colleagues. You wouldn't fly in a plane, cross a bridge, use a computer, or anything else, where your manager or designer is against a fantastically large majority of experts in his or her area of knowledge.

What conspiracy? The conspiracy of big fossil money? Yes, that would be Republicans. They need to get re-elected, and they don't care about you. As long as they have TV ads (and TV execs laughing all the way to the bank) they think they're golden. But they too have kids.

How dumb is that? How dangerous?

Hint: Republicans only want what's in it for them. They don't care about you.

replies.commentBody: I know about the little real estate thing goin' on between N.C.ians and "Floridians." Buyin' up property like crazy, huh?

comments.commentBody: Not surprising.  The Donald agrees with them that there's no such thing as global climate change, so together they won't have to worry about green slime and coastal flooding and the Zika virus.  They can just get on with the important work of arming all of the white Floridians for the coming revolution.
Never, ever, underestimate the innate racism, bigotry and ignorance of far too many American voters. Nor their propensity to shoot themselves in the foot with their votes...

replies.commentBody:
He is the beautiful reflection of his loves affection
Their love makes him beautiful, so beautiful, so Beautiful.....

He's white, vulgar, and so are they. Home of the money made in colder climes, home of the fantasists who see no rising seas. He's giving the wealthy a tax cut. For the rest, it's enough that he's white and male.

comments.commentBody: The Republican Party has actually nominated for president an irresponsible, unrealistic, naive, petulant, childish, vindictive, prejudiced, bigoted, racist, Islamophobic, anti-Semitic, misogynistic, fascistic, authoritarian, insensitive, erratic, disturbed, irrational, inhuman short-fingered vulgarian  and Grand Wizard of Birtherism named Donald John Trump.

With Trump being a creature born of the TV reality swamp and most of Florida's seniors livin in a TV bubble, it's no wonder they're voting for a "celebrity" instead of a real-world Hillary, warts and all. At least you know what you're getting with her, instead of a loose cannon who will sink the ship of state with this made-for and made-by TV empty suit and tie made in China.

Being a white Floridian does not have to mean being blind to the danger to our nation that an ignorant, evil Donald Trump represents.

Are these Florida voters aware that Trump asked military advisers three separate times why we can't use nuclear weapons since we have them; that Donald wants to cut taxes for the super-rich and increase the deficit by $15 trillion; that Trump has become the poster boy for the KKK and White Supremacists; that Trump has tweeted anti-Semitic messages; that he has openly incited violence toward Hillary Clinton.

And the election is close in Florida? Trump is the guy who openly bragged that he made a killing off the Florida housing crash where thousands of desperate Floridian families were forced out of their homes.

Wake up Sunshine State. Do the right thing for your country and yourselves. Do not help elect Donald Trump. There will be no coming back.

replies.commentBody: Get cash from any liquid accounts. And hide it.  If you have kids, they don't like him.  Transfer assets.  Hock your jewels.  And get out.  Life is too short to live with an idiot.  Lawyer up with the best you can find.  Your friends will know one.

Thanks Winchester. I loosely have a plan B in place, but "it's complicated" - and plans, sometimes easy enough to develop, are not equally easy to implement. Should the unthinkable happen on 11/8, I can imagine quite a few of us will green light plan A - formerly known as plan B and involving a passport.
Best to you... :)

comments.commentBody:
And not this older white native Georgian, who has never been polled.

My husband is a Trump supporter so I know them well- and yes - this 25 yr. marriage is all but broken, because of his ever increasing, irrational hatred of all things democrat, liberal, Clinton, Obama, minorities, etc. He gets his "information" from Fox, Limbaugh, Breitbart, Drudge, Hannity, et al. Conversing is futile as he will immediately erupt. He has also completely forgotten what happened to our savings, jobs and home value, our military service members, and our standing in the world during the GW Bush yrs.

While I know he is a lost cause, hell would freeze over before he would change his mind, I see one argument that might make a few have second thoughts. Trump's promise to deregulate (everything) the financial markets would likely cause a crash that will make '09 look benign. And that's just in his first 100 days. Unless he first starts WWIII because an Iranian flips off one of our "beautiful" ships.

Florida - you have much to repent for, having given us GW Bush via Jeb! Begging you, please don't finish us off with Trump. Please - your children and theirs will thank you - so will I.

replies.commentBody: No worries JS.  The GOP climate change deniers have pretty much guaranteed that that will happen.
exactly - the ones who prefer their own company to live in a vibrant city ........birds of a feather ..........cut it off.  We don't need that many oranges.

@aurelius
It tells you that most of them prefer warmer climes in the winter of their days.

comments.commentBody: Can we just cut Florida off and let it drift into the Atlantic please?  That state is truly a stain on the Republic.

replies.commentBody: No, Trump will not win Florida. It might be close; but he will not win. The urban centers in Florida with the largest populations will offset the "other" Florida.
...and how do you know?  Oh wait, you're just being emotional, you don't have any evidence...just like the rest of the "know-nothings"

That will depend in large part upon the effectiveness Republican voter suppression measures.

There are enough decent people in Florida to defeat Trump but the Republicans have thoroughly crippled American democracy.

comments.commentBody: Trump will win Florida.
